messages.title: Get Brexit done with our new deal

keyPolicies.policyTitle: A superb education for all and new schools for our area
keyPolicies.policyDescription: A track record of increasing funding for every pupil in every school, with more to come, and new schools to make sure there's a place for your child.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Revitalise and regenerate our retail centres
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Prioritising brownfield redevelopment to improve our towns and their high streets, whilst protecting our countryside.
Working hard to improve services, capacity and reliability on the railway, particularly on South Western Railway, and holding their management to account.

Boosting investment after decades of underfunding, and making roads decisions locally to make sure our area receives its fair share. Government investment in our roads since 2015 has already delivered millions of pounds of investment and we must keep up the level of funding for the future.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Local services that keep us safe and secure
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Hundreds of extra police officers; and our armed forces are building the resilience, skills and experience of our young people.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: £23.9m extra for the NHS, with new facilities for our area
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Getting our NHS cutting waiting times and ensuring world-class healthcare right here in north Hampshire.

mentions.otherPartyLeaderCandidate: Jeremy Corbyn, Nicola Sturgeon, Jo Swinson
mentions.tacticalSituation: It's a hung parliament - or a Conservative majority. Your local vote will decide it. Vote Lib Dem, get Jeremy Corbyn. A Lib Dem-Conservative coalition is not an option.

issues.brexitEurope: Get Brexit done with our new deal
issues.education: More funding for every pupil in every school
issues.environment: Ending our contribution to global warming by 2050
issues.health: £33.9 billion extra for the NHS, 40 new hospitals across the country
issues.transport: Faster, longer, better trains, boosting investment in roads

community.content: Gigabit broadband for the whole country, £3.6 billion to help towns invest and attract new businesses

endorsements.endorsement: Jo Swinson says no to second Tory alliance
